title: What's the first thing to do when writing a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think everyone will have their own way of doing this. For me, I decide on the plot first. Other things follow on from this - the situation, the people and the style of writing. It's important to determine who your target audience is going to be - adult, child, etc., and the style of the book - complicated plots target a more adult style, while less complicated one targets a younger reader. The subject may not be suitable for a younger reader. For example, a plot about the higher echelons of the church may not be suitable for younger readers, and similarly plots about the teddy bear's picnic would not suit an older reader.

I do research–a lot of it. When I create the plot, which is the first step when writing a book, I research the topic, around the topic, and about the sub-topics within the topics. That helps me with writing as well: when the topics and sub-topics are ready, and I am all set to create scenes, I can write freely. :)
